verses: Praise waiteth for thee, O God, in Sion: and unto thee shall the vow be performed.
O thou that hearest prayer, unto thee shall
thou choosest, and causest to approach
: we shall be satisfied with the goodness of thy house,
terrible things in righteousness wilt thou answer us, O God of our salvation;
the confidence of all the ends of the earth, and of them that are afar off
Which by his strength setteth fast the mountains;
the noise of the seas, the noise of their waves, and the tumult of the people.
They also that dwell in the uttermost parts are afraid at thy
: thou makest the outgoings of the morning and evening to rejoice.
Thou visitest the earth, and waterest it: thou greatly enrichest it with the river of God,
is full of water: thou preparest them
, when thou hast so provided for it.
Thou waterest the ridges thereof abundantly: thou settlest the furrows thereof: thou makest it soft with showers: thou blessest the
Thou crownest the year with thy goodness; and thy paths drop fatness.
the pastures of the wilderness: and the little hills rejoice on every side.
The pastures are clothed with flocks; the valleys also are covered over with corn; they shout for joy, they also sing.
